data.title: Disappointed
data.text: I walked in with a friend for a lunch to go. I ordered a burger and she a salad. We waited 45 mins to get the food! My friend enjoyed the salad however, the burger made me ill, literally. Not only was it not very enjoyable, but I was in so much pain right after eating it. Thus, I won't go back.

data.title: too many chips, not enough guacamole
data.text: The food was great. Extensive tequila list and they were actually able to make a pretty decent skinny margarita (skinny margaritas are not on the drink menu btw). The service was very fast- too fast actually. I could have used more time between apps and dinner and probably would have had another drink and maybe dessert if I'd had more time to digest. My main complaint was the serving size of guacamole and salsa you get compared to the amount of chips. It was almost comical. I have no problem paying for my chips and salsa, but the portion was so tiny and they gave us what would equal an entire bag of tortilla chips. The chips, guac and salsa were awesome though.

data.title: Surprisingly Good
data.text:
Visiting relative in Fall River creates a continuing search for good places to eat.  This place was a pleasant surprise. We went on a Sunday about 1:00 and we're the only diners.  The music was blaring but they kindly agreed to turn it down.  We had avocado fries, shrimp quesadillas, burger with guacamole and the Texan (chicken) burrito.  All delicious.  Oddly if you wanted salsa that was an extra charge.  That's never been the case in the countless other Mexican restaurants we've been to.  Chips and salsa are usually gratis.  Dessert was wonderful!  We split a slice of key lime pie and an order of churros.  OMG.  You must try them.
Our server, Laurel, was so terrific.  Ask for her.  Wonderful personality, excellent, attentive service which just made the whole experience great.

data.title: Delicious
data.text:
Great vegetarian options, and with extra choices on how to have it. 
Extensive drinks menu. 
Service was good and quick

data.title: Worth the adventure in trying to find it!
data.text: Recommended by a fellow Mexican food lover and she was right.  Super fresh items, good size portions( 1/2 of burrito left over for next day).  If coming from the south a travel experience through most of Fall River, but still worth the adventure.  Waite staff wonderful and hostess spent time explaining the building itself which is in the historical district.  Try the fried avocado!  A Groupon is worth the price!

data.title: Good Food, Good Prices
data.text: A friend gave us a Groupon to try Tequila Lime so we figured why not. My fiancé and I both had a house margarita and started off with some nachos. The nachos are piled high, and not only have shredded cheese but also a homemade cheese sauce. My biggest gripe with nachos is when they aren't layered properly, and after eating everything off the top layer, you are left with plain chips underneath. These nachos have the potential to be a 10, but they fall short at a measly 5. My fiancé ordered the steak quesadilla. The menu says it has cheese, but there was no cheese present on here quesadilla! The marinated steak has good flavor, but the onions and peppers are diced so finely, they are barely present to the naked eye. I ordered the fish tacos. Grilled cod was the choice of fish which is common for this area. It would be great if someone would use something like tuna, mahi mahi, sea bass, etc.... Instead of the same old cod fish. The tacos had nice flavor, and the plate presentation was nice, but the portion size of the fish was not large at all. With that being said, the prices are in line with the value. We would visit again, but try a different dish on our next visit.

data.title: poor service average food
data.text: first of all only Mexican restaurant that does not servive comp chips and salsa, cost 7.00, then the wait for service and food was way too long, do not recommend because after food was served it was edible but not good, bad when memory of food is a bad thought.

data.title: Mexican lunch
data.text: Nice atmosphere. Good service. Fried Avocado DELICIOUS. Everything was great. Never had Black Beans before, they were seasoned perfectly. The pork was so tasty and my sandwich was loaded. Definitely make this a choice

data.title: 1st time visitor
data.text: Brought my family here for supper.  Kids really liked the cheese quesodillas.  My wife had a chourico and pepper one and it was delicious. She suggests the lava cocktail. It us a strawberry and coconut rum cocktail.  We will be returning soon without the children. Good size portions

data.title: Great food and service
data.text: I really enjoyed this restaurant. I tried the avocado fries which were delicious and the shrimp tacos which I would recommend also. Good size portions and the service was excellent. We will definetly be going back. It's hard to find good Mexican food in this area.

data.title: Very good food!
data.text: The food was very good and filling.  We were a little surprised that there was a significant charge for the basket of chips/tortilla chips when seated that most mexican restaurants give complimentary.  The drinks were very good and food was plentiful.

data.title: Good food
data.text: We recently visited the restaurant and was pleased that we did.  The four of us all ordered different meals, and we were all satisfied.  My wife ordered a daily special, I ordered a burrito, my son a quesadilla and my daughter a salad.  We started with chips and salsa...freshly made chips and salsa, no bagged stuff here.  There was a full bar, with an extensive specialty drink menu.  The service was excellent.  We would visit again!

data.title: Cool place.
data.text: This is a cool place to meet friends for a drink or grab some margaritas.I wasnt overly impressed with the food but it wasnt bad .The burrito was a good size and everything is reasonably priced.

data.title: Mediocre food, inconsistent visits, but good muddled margaritas
data.text:
I've eaten at Tequila Lime about 10 times.  I really like the location, and the atmosphere is a nice change from other Fall River restaurants.  It always seems busy with a good spectrum of customers. 

The muddled fruit margaritas are fantastic, admittedly one of the best margaritas I have had.  I love that they include lime, fresh muddled fruit, and liquor rather than sugary sour mixes like most other places. However, in my 10 visits, I've never had a great overall experience.  The food is mediocre and on multiple occasions, the food I received is missing several ingredients listed on the menu.  Beyond missing ingredients, the food tends to be bland and dry.  They offer a few hot sauce choices on the table, but that isn't a coverall for serving a bland food.

I saw other reviews that noted chips and salsa were not free.  I don't have a problem paying for chips and salsa, but they are not very good.  The salsa is more of a pico de gallo which somehow doesn't have much flavor other than the onion.

data.title: Awesome, Awesome Aweaome!
data.text: Best place in Fall River. Hands down. I've had quite a variety and all were delicious, fresh and homemade. Drinks too! The basil-vodka gimlet is amazing. The fish tacos and "Green Monster" are the ultimate taste sensation. Nachos? Best anywhere. Homemade! Can't say enough good things about this quaint little gem.

data.title: Fall River style Mexican
data.text:
When you want ethnic cuisine in Fall River stick with Portuguese restaurants. Fall River has a strong Portuguese population and some of the best are in Fall River.
Fall River has it's own take on Chinese served 'Fall River Style'. When residents from Fall River (and to be fair surrounding towns too) move away they will ask you to bring some chow mein noodles from 'Oriental Chow Mein Company' in Fall River when you visit, or to quote a blog  "... just pick up the noodles and drive back to New York", now we all know New York has a China Town so I rest my case.
Same thing goes for things like Chourico and Chip sandwiches. Makes it easy to have your sandwich with fries. A friend from Washington DC will plan a layover in Warwick long enough to get to Fall River for a Chourico and Chip sandwich. It's true.
I thought I would mention all of this before I talk about Tequila Lime. A Portuguese friend from work (get the picture) suggested we try it. 
This is a small neighborhood restaurant with a bar. It was noisy, people were making out at the bar (dinner and a show) and the Mexican was Fall River style. I had a Tostada salad (just okay) and my friend had a Cowabunga burrito (okay not great). They were about $10.00 each and were served with Fall River style chips (that's not on the menu but you get the idea). They are a cross between tortilla chips and pita chips. See what I mean? If you want Fall River style Mexican food with a little show on the side then this is the place! 
Will I go back? Maybe with a friend from Fall River ;)

data.title: Mexican restaurant?
data.text:
My fiancé and I were in the mood for some good Mexican food,  I wanted to try a new place so we decided to eat at this establishment. We were very surprised that they charge $ 7.00 for chips and salsa! !!! That's outrageous, not just the price, but the fact they even charging any amount, is ridiculous chips and salsa in any Mexican restaurant is complimentary, is such a big no-no! Not even the most expensive mexican restaurant in Las Vegas does something so ridiculous. It's  like putting bread and butter on the menu and charge $7.00!!!
 In general the food was blah. The steak tacos and the steak were cold and tasteless. 
The only good thing about this restaurant was the server, she was very sweet and nice. I feel bad for her, because she didn't know what to say when we asked why are you guys charging for chips and salsa?

data.title: loved it
data.text: This is a very cool place and the food is outstanding. Not your typical refried beans Mexican food. Everything was light and freshly made. You could taste all the different flavors and you have to try the avocado fries!

data.title: First Visit Won't be the Last!
data.text:
Stumbled upon Tequila Lime for the first time today, and stopped in for lunch. Love it!! The space is very old, which gives it so much character.  Bar is nice, multi-level dining adds interest and breaks up the space. Service was fast and friendly. Food was beautifully presented, fresh and delicious!  We had Blue Buffalo Burrito and Chicken Tacos. Both were huge (took 1/2 home). Indulged in the churros for dessert...can't wait to come back for dinner...and the home made Key Lime pie :)

Note to management:  Would be wise to add some curtains or other textiles in the space -- the high ceilings and hard surfaces make the echoes a bit much to bear at times.  We were there for lunch, and the music was very loud.  I can imagine that it could get ear-piercing in there with a crowd at dinnertime.

data.title: Not Tex-Mex, but you won't be disappointed
data.text: Good Mexican restaurants are few and far between in New England. This is one of the very good ones. The atmosphere at TLC is one of people enjoying their food and each other's company. The service is efficient and friendly, and we have never been rushed even on a busy night. The menu has many of the usual items you would expect at a typical Mexican restaurant, but the presentations are not necessarily traditional. If this will disappoint you, then find another non-chain Mexican restaurant if you can. If you are willing to be a little adventurous, you are likely to thoroughly enjoy your meal. My favorite is the fish tacos, only available on Fridays. The avocado fries appetizer is unusual but surprisingly addictive. You can customize your margarita with a selection of tequilas. There are no beers on tap, but a good selection of bottled Mexican and other beers. If you are looking for a place to have a lively meal with good food and good friends, this is the place.
